issue.title: Add golang and psutil to all containers
issue.body:
Supporting BoringSSL build & new parallel testing
- [x] ubuntu
- [x] alpine
- [x] debian
- [x] centos7
- [x] centos8

comment.body:
@jimouris All right then: What about doing one without not doing the other then: I very much like the efficiency of your current CCI config.yml. So, what about keeping this as one job and add parallel jobs using the different (platform's) openquantumsafe/ci-containers? 
Here's what the new ci-ubuntu-bionic container just gave me:
```
root@1d4efb5ad6ed:/# ls -l /usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk-amd64/include
total 216
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 21906 Apr 15 21:12 classfile_constants.h
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 12458 Apr 15 21:12 jawt.h
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root  8151 Apr 15 21:12 jdwpTransport.h
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 74987 Apr 15 21:12 jni.h
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 81790 Apr 15 21:12 jvmti.h
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root  4771 Apr 15 21:12 jvmticmlr.h
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root  4096 Jun 19 05:28 linux
root@1d4efb5ad6ed:/# echo $JAVA_HOME
/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.11.0-openjdk-amd64
root@1d4efb5ad6ed:/# java --version
openjdk 11.0.7 2020-04-14
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.7+10-post-Ubuntu-2ubuntu218.04)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 11.0.7+10-post-Ubuntu-2ubuntu218.04, mixed mode, sharing)
root@1d4efb5ad6ed:/# 
```
So I think we should be good from that perspective.
The containers will be available on docker hub as soon as [this PR](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/ci-containers/pull/44) is merged (probably later today). 
If they all run OK, we'd get certainty about b) above and may consider pushing those tests then to a conditional trigger only if they truly take much longer to run than your test (as I fear).

issue.title: Setup CircleCI
issue.body:
Address issue #4.

Install liboqs dependencies and build it, build liboqs-java and run both the tests and the examples. [Here](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-java) is the liboqs-java CircleCI status.

comment.body: @jimouris, @baentsch; please let me know when this is ready to merge (I'm not sure if you are still waiting on some containers to be setup)

issue.title: Ubuntu and OSX CCI added (implements #41)
issue.body:
Should run OK once liboqs-dotnet is 'followed' in CircleCI (@dstebila to activate).

Ran OK at [my CCI account](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/baentsch/liboqs-dotnet/11/workflows/d035a305-17ab-44c7-9e20-b4d9f93cb97a )

If you know of other Linux' that should be tested, please let me know: I'll then also streamline this once main-CI-images are updated with `dotnet` preload.

comment.body: Great @baentsch! Is this ready? Douglas enabled CCI for this project, right?

issue.title: Integrated SIKE v3.3
issue.body:
New in Version 3.3
- Improved versions of the four parameter sets for compressed SIDH and compressed SIKE
- Optimized implementations of the field arithmetic for 64-bit ARMv8 processors for Linux.
- General optimizations to the field arithmetic.
- Support for Mac OS X for the optimized x64 assembly implementations.
- Support for big endian platforms, specifically IBM s390x processors.

TODO before merge:
- [ ] Address all `FIXMEOQS`
- [ ] Enabled optimizations on Darwin
- [ ] Integrate [latest commits](https://github.com/microsoft/PQCrypto-SIDH/commit/a971e7758c164a4770af8003ca2d16a493b862e7) from SIKE above v3.3

comment.body: @dstebila, @xvzcf; some Linux tests (e.g., [centos 7](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/808/workflows/045d4643-ae5c-4685-8620-9871c09c34f2/jobs/8268/steps)) are running out of time and therefore failing. What should I do? Can we increase test time in CircleCI?
